intro: Seseli afghanicum, commonly known as Afghan seseli, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, including Afghanistan. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are often finely divided, and the flowers are usually white or pale green, adding a subtle aesthetic to its natural habitat. Seseli afghanicum is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological significance in its native range.
